intro: Rhynchelythrum, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its striking, spiky flower heads and silvery-blue foliage, which are adapted to coastal environments. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils along the shores of the Mediterranean and other temperate regions. Its flowers are often visited by bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance. Rhynchelythrum species are valued for their ornamental appeal and resilience to salt spray and wind.
